item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

I’ve had one pet, though why would I be sensitive toward someone giving something $13 million that doesn’t deserve, or need, it?

item.title: 4 year old cat becomes a multimillionaire
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:23, topic:425901”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=528586.msg3856420#msg3856420 date=1324382179]
Lothy and Frell: Don’t be hypocrites. When you die would you give every penny that you had to charity and not to your children/family?
[/quote]
It depends on what said offspring are like. I would never leave a substantial sum of money to a pet though, so in that regard I’m certainly not being hypocritical.[/quote]Imagine the relationship she had with the cat though.

inb4sexual

Read full topic
item.source: 4 year old cat becomes a multimillionaire

item.title: 4 year old cat becomes a multimillionaire
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Lothy:

You’re comparing apples and oranges. Leaving an inheritance for your offspring is in no way the same as leaving money to a cat.

She’s not actually leaving it to the cat though. All she wanted was someone who will take care of her cat like she always did, and that requires money. So the cat doesn’t own the money, a foundation does. The main goal of that foundation is to ensure the cat has a nice life.

Perhaps such a foundation turns into a charity.

Read full topic
item.source: 4 year old cat becomes a multimillionaire

item.title: 4 year old cat becomes a multimillionaire
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“SpeedIsMeh, post:20, topic:425901”][quote author=Niall link=topic=528586.msg3856822#msg3856822 date=1324411707]

Lothy and Frell: Don’t be hypocrites. When you die would you give every penny that you had to charity and not to your children/family?

Actually mine was a stab at charities.

how was it a stab at charities ??
[/quote]
He said charities only used 1% of every dollar they received.[/quote]

[quote=“Frell, post:21, topic:425901”][quote author=Niall link=topic=528586.msg3856822#msg3856822 date=1324411707]

Lothy and Frell: Don’t be hypocrites. When you die would you give every penny that you had to charity and not to your children/family?

Actually mine was a stab at charities.

how was it a stab at charities ??
[/quote]
For every dollar you donate we will spend a penny on the poor[/quote]

well that’s just plain fucking wrong

hell as far as I’m aware, in the uk and most sane parts of the world, if a registered charity says they’ll use 5% of all money for admin costs, 15% for advertising and 80% to actually helping people then they are required by law to do just that

Read full topic
item.source: 4 year old cat becomes a multimillionaire

item.title: 4 year old cat becomes a multimillionaire
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:25, topic:425901”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=528586.msg3857145#msg3857145 date=1324423065]

Lothy and Frell: Don’t be hypocrites. When you die would you give every penny that you had to charity and not to your children/family?

It depends on what said offspring are like. I would never leave a substantial sum of money to a pet though, so in that regard I’m certainly not being hypocritical.
[/quote]
Would you give $13 million to a human child?
You say that a cat doesn’t deserve that, but why does your child deserve a big chunk of money when it could be used to help a lot of people?[/quote]
You’re comparing apples and oranges. Leaving an inheritance for your offspring is in no way the same as leaving money to a cat.

Read full topic

item.title: 4 year old cat becomes a multimillionaire
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

I agree with you, everyone that inherited more than $1.3M should only keep $1.3M and give rest to charity, nobody needs more than $1.3M in their life. (When you take into consideration that the money will grow and you have a job).

PS: I’m not serious, I would remove the whole “getting money because you parent were rich” system, and not just set a limit on it.

Read full topic
